text:
Based on the search results, here are the top places to visit in Paris for planning your trip:

1. Eiffel Tower - The iconic symbol of Paris and a must-visit attraction. Go to the top for panoramic city views.

2. Louvre Museum - One of the world's largest art museums, home to famous works like the Mona Lisa. 

3. Notre-Dame Cathedral - The famous medieval Catholic cathedral known for its architecture, though currently closed for renovations after the 2019 fire.

4. Musée d'Orsay - Art museum housing the world's largest collection of Impressionist and Post-Impressionist works. 

5. Arc de Triomphe - The famous monument at the western end of the Champs-Élysées.

6. Montmartre - A charming hilltop neighborhood with cobblestone streets, the famous Sacré-Cœur basilica, and Place du Tertre square.

7. Palace of Versailles - The opulent former royal residence located just outside Paris.

8. Seine River Cruise - See Paris' famous monuments and architecture from the water on a scenic cruise.

9. Sainte-Chapelle - A 13th century Gothic chapel with stunning stained-glass windows.

10. Jardin du Luxembourg - Beautiful gardens surrounding the Luxembourg Palace.

Plan to spend at least 3-4 days to cover the major sights. The Paris Pass can help you save on admission to top attractions. Book tickets in advance to avoid long lines, especially at the Eiffel Tower and Louvre.

Based on the information provided, here are the top 10 things to do in Paris that would be most relevant for planning your trip:

1. Visit the Eiffel Tower - Take in panoramic views of Paris from this iconic landmark. Book tickets in advance.

2. Explore Notre Dame Cathedral - Admire the Gothic architecture and climb the towers for great views. Currently closed for renovations after the 2019 fire.

3. See art masterpieces at the Louvre Museum - The world's largest art museum housing famous works like the Mona Lisa. Book tickets ahead of time. 

4. Stroll the Champs-Élysées to the Arc de Triomphe - Walk along the famous shopping avenue to Napoleon's triumphal arch. Climb to the top for city views.

5. Take a Seine River cruise - See Paris lit up at night on a scenic dinner cruise along the Seine. Book in advance.

6. Explore artsy Montmartre - Visit Sacré-Cœur Basilica, watch artists at work in Place du Tertre square, see the famous Moulin Rouge cabaret.

7. Tour the Palace of Versailles - Marvel at the opulent former royal residence and gardens. Book tickets ahead.

8. Wander the Latin Quarter - Explore this historic Left Bank neighborhood known for its cafes, bookshops and the Luxembourg Gardens. 

9. See a show at the Moulin Rouge - Attend the legendary cabaret show with dinner. Book tickets well in advance as it sells out.

10. Visit Disneyland Paris - Enjoy the two theme parks located just outside the city. Purchase tickets ahead of time.

Let me know if you need any other tips for your Paris trip planning! The city has so much to offer.

The webpage provides relevant information for planning a trip to Paris, specifically about dining at the Eiffel Tower. Key points:

- The 58 Tour Eiffel restaurant is located on the 1st floor of the Eiffel Tower and offers great views of Paris. However, reservations are currently unavailable through this website.

- As alternatives, they suggest booking skip-the-line tickets to visit the Eiffel Tower or dining at the nearby Bistro Parisien restaurant which also has Eiffel Tower views. 

- The page includes photos of the restaurant interior and food. Customer reviews praise the excellent service, food, and ambiance, though one notes not getting a requested window seat.

- Tips provided include booking well in advance as it's a popular experience, and allowing extra time for security checks and elevator waits.

So in summary, while the 58 Tour Eiffel restaurant itself is booked up, the page offers helpful related suggestions and reviews to assist in planning Eiffel Tower dining and visiting logistics as part of a Paris trip. The information seems quite relevant to your planning needs.

The webpage provides detailed information about the Eiffel Tower in Paris, which is highly relevant for planning a trip to Paris. Key points:

- The Eiffel Tower is an iconic iron tower located in the Champ de Mars in Paris. It was built in 1889 for the International Exhibition.

- At 324 meters tall, it was the tallest monument in the world for 41 years. It has 4 floors.

- It attracts over 7 million visitors per year, making it the most visited paid monument globally. 

- The tower is illuminated for special events like Bastille Day fireworks on July 14th.

- There is a restaurant called 58 Tour Eiffel located in the tower. 

- The page also lists nearby activities and attractions like river cruises, the Aquarium of Paris, Musée Grévin wax museum, and hop-on hop-off bus tours.

In summary, this webpage provides an excellent overview of the Eiffel Tower and surrounding attractions that would be very useful for someone planning a trip to Paris and wanting to visit this famous landmark. The content is highly relevant to the given prompt.

The Grand Palais in Paris seems like a relevant and interesting place to visit for your trip. Here are the key highlights about it from the webpage:

- The Grand Palais is a 77,000 sq m building located close to the Champs-Elysées and opposite the Petit Palais. It is considered one of the most beautiful buildings in the 8th arrondissement and all of Paris.

- It was originally built for the 1900 Universal Exhibition. A design competition was held in 1896 and the winning design was by 4 architects working together. 

- The building exemplifies the intellectual and cultural influence of France. It hosted the largest art fairs and many cultural, sport and social events in its early years, including a popular annual horse show from 1901-1957.

- Over time, it transitioned from hosting elite fine art salons to more popular events and technical/commercial fairs. The west wing houses the Palais de la Découverte science museum which opened in 1937.

- Today, the Grand Palais still welcomes over 2 million visitors and 40 events each year, playing host to major international fairs and prestigious events in Paris.

So in summary, it is an architecturally stunning historic building that provides insight into Parisian art and culture over the past century. Including it in your Paris itinerary could allow you to appreciate its design and perhaps attend an interesting exhibition or event held there.

The webpage provides detailed information about the Louvre Museum in Paris, which would be very helpful for planning your trip. Here are the key points:

- The Louvre is one of the largest museums in the world, located in central Paris. It exhibits around 35,000 objects from prehistory to the 21st century.

- With over 8 million visitors per year, it is the most visited museum in the world. 

- The museum is housed in the Louvre Palace, originally built as a fortress in the late 12th century under Philip II. The building was extended many times to form the present Louvre Palace.

- The museum opened on 10 August 1793 with an exhibition of 537 paintings. The collection has grown over the centuries under various French rulers.

- In 2008, the collection was divided into 8 departments, including Egyptian Antiquities, Greek/Etruscan/Roman Antiquities, Islamic Art, Paintings, Sculpture and more.

- You can book tickets to the Louvre Museum with an audioguide. 

The page also lists some nearby attractions and activities you may want to check out, like the Orsay Museum, Sainte Chapelle, a Seine river cruise, etc.

In summary, this is a very relevant and informative page for planning the Louvre Museum visit as part of your Paris trip. It provides the museum's history, collections, ticketing and other helpful tips.
